alert.note: Alert for Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Salton Sea (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued June 12 at 10:20PM PDT until June 13 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TO 11 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...West winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. * WHERE...Salton Sea, Imperial Valley and Western Imperial County. * WHEN...From 6 PM to 11 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution. Continue to monitor NWS forecasts, broadcast outlets, and local government for updates.

area.areaDesc: Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Salton Sea
